alert.note: Alert for Indian River; Martin; Okeechobee; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 30 at 7:54AM EDT until April 30 at 8:15AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT FOR ST. LUCIE...EASTERN OKEECHOBEE...SOUTHEASTERN INDIAN RIVER AND NORTHWESTERN MARTIN COUNTIES... At 753 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northwest of Tradition, or 13 miles west of White City, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Sebastian and Stuart. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for east central Florida. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into a small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Indian River; Martin; Okeechobee; St. Lucie
